comments:
I got an NPE on DataStore.createElement, shown below.
The NPE was printed on stderr.
What I had done was create several shells in quick succession from the RSE Tree (Right-click > Launch Shell) while trying to reproduce bug 142953.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.dstore.core.model.DataStore.createElement(DataStore.java:3670)
	at org.eclipse.dstore.core.model.DataStore.createObject(DataStore.java:1249)
	at org.eclipse.dstore.core.model.DataStore.createObject(DataStore.java:1196)
	at org.eclipse.dstore.core.model.DataStore.createObject(DataStore.java:1166)
	at org.eclipse.rse.internal.services.dstore.shell.DStoreShellThread.init(DStoreShellThread.java:65)
	at org.eclipse.rse.internal.services.dstore.shell.DStoreShellThread.<init>(DStoreShellThread.java:59)
	at org.eclipse.rse.services.dstore.shells.DStoreHostShell.<init>(DStoreHostShell.java:39)
	at org.eclipse.rse.services.dstore.shells.DStoreShellService.launchShell(DStoreShellService.java:75)
	at org.eclipse.rse.services.dstore.shells.DStoreShellService.launchShell(DStoreShellService.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.shells.core.subsystems.servicesubsystem.ShellServiceSubSystem.internalRunShell(ShellServiceSubSystem.java:143)
	at org.eclipse.rse.internal.subsystems.shells.subsystems.RemoteCmdSubSystem.runShell(RemoteCmdSubSystem.java:848)
I've updated DataStore so that the newObject is never null in that case.  I'll still want to look into why the recycled list contains a null element.

With my change, I just tried creating 20 shells in quick succession and didn't hit this problem (nor did I hit 142953 - perhaps that's caused by the null pointer?).  Anyway, the null pointer problem is fixed now.
